contentrichtext.text: '''John Fraser''' may refer to: {{tocright}} ==Politics== *[[John Simon Frederick Fraser]] (1765–1803), commanded the Fraser Fencibles in Ireland and was (M.P.) for Inverness-shire *[[John James Fraser]] (1829–1896), Canadian politician *[[John Fraser (Ontario politician)]] (1849–1928), Canadian Member of Parliament for Lambton East, Ontario *[[John Fraser (BC politician)]] (1866–1960), Canadian Member of Parliament from British Columbia *[[Sir Malcolm Fraser, 1st Baronet]] (John Malcolm Fraser, 1878–1949), British newspaper editor and political agent *John [[Malcolm Fraser]] (born 1930), 22nd Prime Minister of Australia, 1975–1983 *[[John Allen Fraser]] (born 1931), Speaker of the Canadian House of Commons, 1986–1993 *[[John Fraser (British politician)]] (born 1934), British Member of Parliament for Norwood *[[John A. Fraser (politician)]] (1840–1908), political figure in Nova Scotia *[[John G. Fraser]], Orange Free State politician ==Sports== *[[John Fraser (Canadian soccer)]] (1880–1959), Canadian soccer player and member of the 1904 Olympic Games Canadian Team *[[John Fraser (footballer born 1876)]] (1876–1952), Scottish footballer, Southampton player and Dundee manager *[[John Fraser (footballer born 1936)]], Hibernian footballer *[[John Fraser (footballer born 1953)]], Fulham footballer *[[John Fraser (footballer born 1938)]], Northern Ireland footballer *[[John Fraser (footballer born 1978)]], Scottish footballer whose clubs include Ross County, Clyde and Forfar Athletic *[[John Fraser (tennis)]] (born 1935), Australian tennis player of the 1950s and 60s ==Academia== *[[John Fraser (botanist)]] (1750–1811), Scottish botanist *[[John Fraser (academic)]] (c. 1823–1878), president of Pennsylvania State University, 1866–1868 *[[John Fraser (Celticist)]] (1882–1945), Jesus Professor of Celtic at Oxford University *[[John Fraser (journalist)]] (born 1944), Canadian journalist and master of Massey College, University of Toronto ==Others== *[[John Fraser (frontiersman)]] (1721–1773), Colonial Pennsylvanian fur trader and soldier *[[John Fraser (bishop)]] (died 1507), Bishop of Ross, Scotland *[[John Fraser (British Army officer)]] (1760–1843) *[[John Fraser (poet)]] (c. 1809–1849), Irish poet *[[John Fraser (novelist, poet)]] (born 1937), English professor, novelist, and poet *[[John Fraser (horticulturalist)]] (1821–1900), horticulturalist *[[John Fraser (architect)]] (1825–1906), American architect *[[John Arthur Fraser]] (1838–1898), Canadian painter *[[John Fraser (painter)]] (1858–1927), English painter *Sir [[John Foster Fraser]] (1868–1936), British Parliamentary correspondent and travel writer *[[John Fraser (auditor)]], Auditor General of Canada, 1905–1919 *[[John Fraser (educator)]], Principal of Edinburgh University, 1944–1948 *[[John Fraser (critic)]] (born 1928), English/Canadian author, literary theorist, and cultural analyst *[[John Fraser (actor)]] (born 1931), Scottish actor *[[John MacLeod Fraser]], former [[List of Canadian ambassadors to China|Canadian ambassador to China]] *[[John Fraser (film producer)]] (1930–2010), Australian film producer and cinema executive *[[John Fraser (d. 1306)]], Scottish independence fighter, brother of [[Simon Fraser (d. 1306)|Simon Fraser]] *[[John Alexander Fraser (GC)]] (1896–1943), British recipient of the George Cross *[[John Fraser (minister)]] (1894–1985), Moderator of the General Assembly of the Church of Scotland, 1958–1959 *[[John A. Fraser (businessman)]] (born 1951), Australian businessman <!--*[[John Fraser (painter)]] (1858–1927), British painter http://www.torre-abbey.org.uk/torreabbeycatalogue.pdf --><!-- needs blue link --> ==See also== *[[John Frazer (disambiguation)]] *[[Jonathan Fraser]] (born 1967), American actor {{hndis|Fraser, John}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Fraser, John}}
